revised_title: Observations on the Regularity of Mr. Ellicott's Clock at St. Helena
tldr: The author describes the observations made on Mr. Ellicott's clock at St. Helena, noting its regularity and the impact of environmental factors on its performance. The clock was found to be accurate within a second of time, with the accuracy affected by the dryness of the location. The author also discusses the limitations of using an equal altitude instrument for such observations.
